snippet: Kevin Faulconer’s victory will make San Diego the largest city run by a Republican and raises the possibility that the new mayor could help rebuild the party in California.
abstract: Election of Republican city councilman Kevin Faulconer to become San Diego's mayor is rare bright spot for Republican Party that has been eclipsed at the state level in California.

byline.original: By LIAM DILLON and JENNIFER MEDINA
byline.contributor: Liam Dillon reported from San Diego, and Jennifer Medina from Fresno, Calif.

lead_paragraph: Kevin Faulconer’s victory will make San Diego the largest city run by a Republican and raises the possibility that the new mayor could help rebuild the party in California.

headline.main: Mayoral Victory in San Diego Offers Some Hope to California’s Struggling G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: Mayoral Victory in San Diego Offers Some Hope to California’s Struggling G.O.P.
